"I . . ." 
Every muscle of Telydnin's pale, terrified face began to quiver, his eyes still shifted from side to side but with a downward look not ris- ing to Rost6v's face, and his sobs were audible. 
"Countl . . . Don't ruin a young fellow . . . here is this wretched money, take it . . ." He threw it on the table. "I have an old father and mother! . . ." 
RostcW took the money, avoiding Telynin's eyes, and went o'ut of the room without a word. But at the door he stopped and then retraced h
